description:
We have an amazing opportunity for an experienced Procurement and Sourcing Specialist who thrives on maintaining a robust supply chain, ensuring product quality, and achieving cost efficiency.
We are centrally located just off the interstate so your commute will be a breeze, and once you get into the office you will find a friendly group that really has each other’s back. This is a dynamic workplace, and the right candidate will have strong analytical, negotiation, and communication skills.
Responsibilities:
  • Analyze financial and procurement data to craft effective negotiation strategies.
  • Approve purchasing contracts with the best possible terms.
  • Apply sourcing strategies specific to aerospace, automotive, and manufacturing sectors.
  • Manage and maintain accurate MRP inputs, including supplier details, lead times, and pricing.
  • Assist the Purchasing Manager in creating and implementing policies and procedures to optimize workflow and cost efficiencies.
  • Write specifications, prepare bids, and handle the bidding process.
  • Analyze market availability, suggest awards, and prepare foreign and domestic quotations based on provided information.
  • Drive supplier performance by establishing key performance metrics.
  • Communicate effectively about variations in delivery, quality, price, or conditions of sale.
  • Purchase supplies and materials at optimal prices and delivery cycles while maintaining minimal inventory levels.
  • Adapt to changing market conditions to ensure supply chain availability and quality compliance.
  • Work collaboratively with Operations, IT, Finance, Research & Development, and Marketing to support supply chain activities and product costings.
  • Keep clear and accurate records of quotations for future reference.
  • Provide timely and accurate information for quoting all items and verify quotations based on prior quotes, current market prices, and customer purchasing history.
  • Notify supervisors or managers of potential safety hazards.
  • Perform other tasks and duties as required by management.

Qualifications: • Proven experience in procurement and sourcing within aerospace, automotive, or manufacturing environments.• Degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, or Business Management or 5 + years of relevant experience in manufacturing, automotive, or aerospace. • Strong analytical and negotiation skills.• MS Office Suites (Excel advanced user)• Expertise in managing MRP inputs and understanding of sourcing strategies.• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.• Ability to work cross-functionally and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.• Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.• International purchasing experience is beneficial.• APICS ASCM Certification a plus
